item.title: vRealize Orchestrator - Kerberos Configuration File
item.description: SLiM - Dec 2, 2020 I think you may have a type-o for [domain_realm] Also please reference the VMware documentation for this * Configure Kerberos Authentication https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Orchestrator/8.2/com.vmware.vrealize.orchestrator-use-plugins.doc/GUID-1A829CCF-A147-422E-80B3-0819F8D6E6AE.html?hWord=N4IghgNiBcINYCcBGBWAdAYwPYDsBmIAvkA #### [Gary]( "garyflynnis@gmail.com") - Dec 5, 2020 Hi Scott, Thanks for spotting the typo. All fixed now. I have also added a link to the document you mentioned. It looks like this documentation was only published in September of this year. Cheers, Gary

item.title: vRealize Orchestrator - Kerberos Configuration File
item.description: To configure Kerberos authentication with vRealize Orchestrator (vRO), the krb5.conf file must be set up for your specific environment and the domain you are connecting to. The location of the krb5.conf file is different for different versions and deployments of vRO, so the below list shows the locations of the krb5.conf file for vRO 7 vs vRO 8 and standalone deployments vs embedded with vRA deployments. In vRO 7.x standalone, the krb5.

item.title: vRealize Orchestrator 8.x - Accessing Control Center UI
item.description: In both vRealize Automation and Orchestrator 8.x, the appliances have been rebuilt using a kubernetes architecture. For this reason, the location of the different Orchestrator user interfaces has changed. Orchestrator Client UI - https://FQDN_or_IP_address:443/orchestration-ui Orchestrator Client Java UI - deprecated from vRO 8.0 onwards Orchestrator Control Center UI - https://FQDN_or_IP_address:443/vco-controlcenter To login to the Orchestrator Control Center UI, the username is 'root' and the password is the same as the appliance 'root' password.
